---
title: "Normalizing your data"
format: html
---

# Introduction

This Quarto notebook demonstrates basic unsupervised machine learning concepts using Python.

## Learning Objectives

- Understand the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning.
- Apply PCA and clustering to example data.
- Visualize results with matplotlib.

## Setup

::: {#51b10325 .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from sklearn.decomposition import PCA
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
```
:::


## Example Data

::: {#e3f100d3 .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# Generate synthetic data
np.random.seed(42)
X = np.vstack([
    np.random.normal(loc=[0, 0], scale=1, size=(50, 2)),
    np.random.normal(loc=[5, 5], scale=1, size=(50, 2))
])
plt.scatter(X[:, 0], X[:, 1])
plt.title("Synthetic Data")
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](normalization_files/figure-html/cell-3-output-1.png){width=569 height=431}
:::
:::


## PCA Example

::: {#78828684 .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
pca = PCA(n_components=2)
X_pca = pca.fit_transform(X)
plt.scatter(X_pca[:, 0], X_pca[:, 1])
plt.title("PCA Projection")
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](normalization_files/figure-html/cell-4-output-1.png){width=569 height=431}
:::
:::


## Clustering Example

::: {#946ef262 .cell execution_count=4}
``` {.python .cell-code}
kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters=2, random_state=42)
labels = kmeans.fit_predict(X)
plt.scatter(X[:, 0], X[:, 1], c=labels)
plt.title("KMeans Clustering")
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](normalization_files/figure-html/cell-5-output-1.png){width=569 height=431}
:::
:::


## Conclusion

- PCA reduces dimensionality for visualization.
- KMeans finds clusters in unlabeled data.
